short_summary: Tender package to be submitted  electronically to fill up the Need-Title M50 Roof Section #4
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement: M50 Roof Section #4

**Official Reference Number:** PW-23-01027359
**Solicitation Number:** 22-58142
**Publication Date:** 2023-02-23
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-03-23T14:00:00
**Amendment Date:** 2023-03-16

**Summary:**
The National Research Council Canada is inviting bidders to submit a tender for the construction of M50 Roof Section #4, part of the Montreal Road Campus.

**Procurement Details:**
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Evaluation Criteria:** Technical Score (40%) and Price Score (60%)
* **Proposal Format:** Technical Proposal and Tender Form

**Requirements:**
* Bidders must have a minimum of 10 years of experience in roofing projects and demonstrate experience comparable to this tender.
* The proposed Project Manager, Site Supervisor, and Site Safety/Fire Officer must have relevant experience and qualifications.
* Bidders must provide a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and a valid Reliability Status, granted or approved by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD).

**Security Clearance:**
The contractor must comply with the Security Requirements Checklist and hold a valid DOS and Reliability Status throughout the performance of the contract.

**Additional Requirements:**
* Bidders must attend a mandatory site visit on March 7th or 8th, 2023, at 9:30 am.
* The contractor will be required to provide a valid WSIB certificate.
* The tender package is available through Buyandsell.gc.ca.

**Contact Information:**
Collin Long, Contracting Authority, [Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca), (343) 549-1549.

**Evaluation Process:**
The evaluation process will be based on a combination of technical score and price score, with the technical score accounting for 40% and the price score accounting for 60% of the total score. Proposals will be evaluated, and notice of individual results will be sent by email to all contractors who submitted a tender. The evaluation process will be led by the Procurement Ombudsman.

**Dispute Resolution:**
